I did, but there are reasons to continue to use JUnit for our project.
One =
is that TestNG adds an additional Framework (we are not getting
away from J=
Unit, due to things like DBUnit), and another is that the
group has kind of=
 had a rocky relationship with testing, and I think
the discipline of focus=
ing on the Unit that JUnit brings is beneficial
in this case.

--- In junit=
@yahoogroups.com, Malte Finsterwalder <malte@...> wrote:
>
> 
> I don't kno=
w whether that's an option for you, but TestNG supports test
> groupings. D=
id you look into that?
> 
> But I'm not sure I understand the way you plan =
to group tests...
> How do you decide, whether a test is run or not?
> How =
do you tell the system that you want to run the slow tests or that
> you do=
n't want to run the slow tests now?
> 
> Greetings,
>    Malte
